On december 9, 2015
MinerX

This is a dice-based forum game (insired by the dark souls franchise altough, I wish I could add more difficulty to it...) where you'll fight and slay stuff... Yeah, you probaly know what I mean, if not, imagine a variation of Dungeons & Dragons

Character sheet:
Name:
Gender:
Level:
Role:
Class:
Health: base 20
Mana: base 10
Status:
Equipment:
-L. Hand:
-R. Hand:
-Head:
-Chest:
-Legs:
-Hands:
Spells:

-Note: spells are divided into abilities, sorcery, pyromancy, miracles and hexes, I'll explain more when needed.

Abilities: usually passive or a class/role based ability

Sorcery: taps into your inteligence to draw power

Miracles: taps into your faith to draw power

Hex: highly difficult and volatile magic that next to having a high skill cap taps into the user's very essence to draw power.

Pyromancy: magic of fire. Next to needing a strong will it's strength increases depending on the user's fire seed essence. You better make sure you have the proper means to cast it, or you might end up with the consequencesâ€¦

F/I: (Faith/inteligence, base 1 for both)
Souls: currency (start with 0)
Items: (limited to 15+Equipment)

Notes:
Armor blocks x amount of physical damage.

Crits cause attacks to do 200% total damage.

Cloaked characters cannot attack on the 1st turn of the cloak, each attack causes their cloaked turns to count down by 1 (gains cloak for 5 turns, can't attack on 1st turn > 4 turns, attacks on 2ND turn > 3 turns - 1 turn for the attack, 2 cloak turns left).
Cloaked characters are affected by AoE but have a 50% dodge chance.

Pyromancy damage calculation: (spell damage- magic resist)*flame seed level
Physical damage: roll D100, if the number<accuracy (default 50)-evasion it is a hit and deals a weapon's designated damage, if the weapon has a crit chance roll a d100, if the number is smaller than the chance multiply the total damage dealt by that weapon by 2 (unless stated otherwise), then the total physical damage dealt by the attack is reduced by the opponent's amount of armor.

Classes:

Warrior*
-Base health increased by 40
-Equipped with a sword (+4 strength)
Roles for warrior:

Vanguard
Gains the vanguard set equipped (2 armor per piece, total of 8 )
-Gains a large shield (25% block chance and a 50% bonus damage reduction while guarding)

berserker
-Gains another sword equipped (+4 damage)
-gains a 50% damage inflicted increase when damaged, a 100% increase when at 1/2 hp or lower and a 200% damage increase when at 10% or lower (minimum 5 hp)

jouster
-attacks have a 25% stagger chance against enemies with a lower max hp than him (while using Lances)
-sword is replaced by a jouster's Lance (6 damage. Gains 100% bonus damage while using a mount and increasing stagger chance to 50%)

footsoldier
-hidden potential?
-Looses 50% less souls at death

Rogue*
-Base hp increased by 20
-Equipped with a dagger (+3 damage, 50% chance to crit becomes 100% if cloaked or attacking the turn after cloak ends.)
Roles for rouges:

Ringleader
-Gains abilities to summon allies!
-bonus to certain rolls based on influence
Rogue scout. Gives details about enemies, often flavor text, but can even tell about what items the enemies are carrying (surifies one drop)
Rogue hired blade. 5 damage, 15 hp
Rogue longbow wielder. 7 damage, 50% crit chance, 10%+ accuracy, 7 hp, ranged
(consumes 1 mana)

Assasin
-Gains abilities that allows him to exell at dealing damage at higher levels

ranger
-Gains a 4 damage bow (ranged, has a 40% crit chance and +10% accuracy)

Magi*
-Gains 15 bonus mana
-Starts off with a begginer spell
Roles for magis:

wizard
-controls mainly sorcery
-wields a staff
-has heightened inteligence (+7),

priest
-uses miracles
-wields staffs and chimes,
-has heightened faith (+7)
-Beware, there is a dark side to everything!
Starts with a rite scroll (no damage, but heals one character by 5 per spell cast!),

pyromancer
-uses the flammability of concentrated mana to cast their (fiery) spells
-all of their spells channel trough their fire catalyst (base damage 2, also stores their fire seed essence wich amplifies their spells)

sealer
-uses hexes
-has a talent for hexes and uses 50% less souls for the casting of them
-uses several catalyst for his spells
Gains a chyme staff (2 damage, used to cast most spells)
-is lightly heightened in both inteligence and faith (+4/+4)

missionary
-Uses his own mana to deal more damage! Praise to the mana flare crystals!
Gains a mana flare staff (+4 damage, deals 3 additional damage per attack for 1 mana)

undertaker
-Summons spirits to fight for him!
-I wonder how many uses his shovel has...?
Gains a shovel (+3 damage, unlocks the "Grave dig" ability, wich summons a random spirit out of a few spirits (all last [lvl/2] turns, min. 1)
Warrior spirit. Does 6 damage per attack, has 10 hp.
Rotting soul feeder. Passive effect of increasing soul ammount by 50% if on the field by the end of the battle. 10 hp.
Soul of a bloodhound. Gives a 25% chance of finding a additional item after battle if on the field when a enemy dies. 7 hp.
(spell uses 3 mana)

Any suggestions are welcome! Ask any questions! I'll aproove the character sheets in the morning! Good luck!

Note: If no other equipment is specified, just start out with tattered robes/leggings/-NA- (none)

You stand in a tall, wide and overall big room, with the top being a dome and there being a circular table with old hags sitting around it, poking at the smokey plate stretching in the middle of it. "Ah look, the new ones are awaking any second nowâ€¦" says one of them from under her hood, wich is black, in contrast with the white walls, illuminated by the yellow hue of the torches. "Last batch was a failure, couldn't even remember their names, not that you'll remember or need to remember much now that you're here... " "hey give them a chance, even if the others got turned into hollows in less than a year doesn't mean these will" says another one, pointing her wrinkled finger between you and the group, and the other hag. "Fine, but mark my words if these end up dying like the others, without knowing anything about themselves or the world they're in I'll make sure that the Boss hears from me! " a deep, rumbling and booming noise is heard from behind a giant gate beyond on the opposite side of the room... You follow the urge to go to the light, meanwhile the hags burst out into a full-blown argument between themselves, sounding like chicken fighting over a kernel. Soon the doors slam shut behind you, in front of you a large staircase leading down a mountain, a small town in the mists below.

On december 17, 2015
MinerX

Shit, right, this. Well, let me explain every roll in more detail.
Combat rolls are made up of a few parts. First comes the accuracy roll (a heads/tails if it's 50/50, a d100 for most other chances if you or your enemy have accuracy or evasion.), then the damage roll (can be skipped if a weapon has a set amount of damage, for example the sword having 4, but if a weapon had 4-7 damage for example, a d4 roll would be needed, 1 being 4 damage and 4 being 7 damage. In the case of the shovel, I'm just randomizing the damage completely). Last comes a critical roll, wich I explained in the starting post. Per attack you can use each weapon once, but it must be equipped (changing weapons takes a turn) and no spell must be cast in the same turn. Spells have their own damage mechanic and usually hit unless specified otherwise. Also, each weapon you attack with needs it's ownhit or miss roll! Not jjust h/t followed by combined damage dice!

Tails1(1 being 7 damage and 4 being 10 damage)
